doc.name: unboundedVScroll

syntax.example: set the unboundedVScroll of group to {true | false}

doc.summary: Specifies whether automatic clamping of the vScroll offsets of a group is on or off.

examples.example: set the unboundedVScroll of group "items" to true

references.property: vScroll Property</property vScrollbar Property hScroll Property</property hScrollbar Property unboundedHScroll Property

description.overview: Use the unboundedVScroll property to turn automatic clamping of the vScroll offset of a group on or off.
description.comments:
When the unboundedVScroll property of a group is set to true and the vScrollbar is not visible, it is possible to set the vScroll property of the group to values outside that of the size of the content (both positive and negative).
If the vScrollbar of the group is made visible or the unboundedVScroll property is turned off and the vScroll value is outside of the content bounds, the group is scrolled to bring the vScroll value within the appropriate range.
